definition: to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: There are also other, less obvious, advantages of numeracy.
sentences.chinese: 动物会识数还有其他的隐性的好处。

sentences.english: This ability may date back to even more primitive organisms than fish.
sentences.chinese: 动物的识数才能甚至可以出现在比鱼还原始的生物中。

definition: to count numbers/to keep to one's word/to hold (i.e. to remain valid)/to count (i.e. to be important)
four rules of arithmetic/addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
to compute on the abacus/(fig.) to calculate/to plan/to scheme
to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
to do a sum in writing/written calculation
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
to be a believer (in a religion, esp. Islam)
Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
